Definition: from {{h2787}}; parched; Charan, the name of a man and also of a place; Haran.
from {{h2763}}; a sickle (as cutting); sickle.
dual of a derivative from {{h2356}}; double cave-town; Choronajim, a place in Moab; Horonaim.
patrial from {{h2773}}; a Choronite or inhabitant of Choronaim; Horonite.
or (with a directive enclitic) חַרְסָה; from an unused root meaning to scrape; also perhaps from the mediating idea of {{h2777}}; the sun; sun.
of uncertain derivation; Charnepher, an Israelite; Harnepher.
from {{h2775}} (apparently in the sense of a red tile used for scraping); a potsherd, i.e. (by implication) a pottery; the name of a gate at Jerusalem; east.
the same as {{h2775}}; shining; Cheres, a mountain in Palestine; Heres.
from {{h2778}}; properly, the crop gathered, i.e. (by implication) the autumn (and winter) season; figuratively, ripeness of age; cold, winter (-house), youth.

a primitive root; also	denominative (from {{h2779}}); to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter; betroth, blaspheme, defy, jeopard, rail, reproach, upbraid.
from {{h2760}}; properly, a net, i.e. (by analogy) lattice; lattice.

a primitive root; to seclude; specifically (by a ban) to devote to religious uses (especially destruction); physical and reflexive, to be blunt as to the nose; make accursed, consecrate, (utterly) destroy, devote, forfeit, have a flat nose, utterly (slay, make away).
a primitive root; to braid (i.e. to entangle or snare) or catch (game) in a net; roast.
(Aramaic) a root probably allied to the equivalent of {{h2787}}; to scorch; singe.
from {{h2763}}; snub-nosed; Charim, an Israelite; Harim.
from {{h2763}}; devoted; Chormah, a place in Palestine; Hormah.

or (Zechariah 14:11) חֶרֶם; from {{h2763}}; physical (as shutting in) a net (either literally or figuratively); usually a doomed object; abstractly extermination; (ac-) curse(-d, -d thing), dedicated thing, things which should have been utterly destroyed, (appointed to) utter destruction, devoted (thing), net.
from {{h2763}}; devoted; Chorem, a place in Palestine; Horem.
from {{h2763}}; abrupt; Chermon, a mount of Palestine; Hermon.
plural of {{h2768}}; Hermons, i.e. its peaks; the Hermonites.
from {{h2790}} in the sense of silence; quiet, i.e. sultry (as feminine noun, the sirocco or hot east wind); vehement.
from {{h2790}}; ploughing or its season; earing (time), ground.
or חֲרִץ; from {{h2782}}; (compare {{h2742}}); properly, incisure or (passively) incised; hence, a threshing-sledge (with sharp teeth); also a slice (as cut); cheese, harrow.
from {{h2778}}; autumnal; Chariph, the name of two Israelites; Hariph.
from the plural of {{h2716}} and the plural of {{h3123}}; or perhaps rather the plural of a single word חֲרָאיוֹן, probably a kind of vegetable; excrements of doves; doves' dung.
or חָרִט; from the same as {{h2747}}; properly, cut out (or hollow), i.e. (by implication) a pocket; bag, crisping pin.
or חוֹרִי; the same as {{h2752}}; Chori, the name of two men; Hori.
from {{h2356}}; cave-dweller or troglodyte; a Chorite or aboriginal Idumaean; Horims, Horites.
from the same as {{h2353}}; white bread; white.
from {{h2734}}; a burning (i.e. intense) anger; fierce, × great, heat.
from the same as {{h2747}}; a horoscopist (as drawing magical lines or circles); magician.
(Aramaic) the same as {{h2748}}; magician.
or (shortened) חָרֹן; from {{h2734}}; a burning of anger; sore displeasure, fierce(-ness), fury, (fierce) wrath(-ful).
a patrial from (probably) a collateral form of {{h2756}}; a Charuphite or inhabitant of Charuph (or Chariph); Haruphite.

or חָרֻץ; passive participle of {{h2782}}; properly, incised or (active) incisive; hence (as noun masculine or feminine) a trench (as dug), gold (as mined), a threshing-sledge (having sharp teeth); (figuratively) determination; also eager; decision, diligent, (fine) gold, pointed things, sharp, threshing instrument, wall.
the same as {{h2742}}; earnest; Charuts, an Israelite; Haruz.
a fuller form of {{h2746}}; inflammation; Charchur, one of the Nethinim; Harhur.
from the same as {{h2775}}; perhaps shining; Charchas, an Israelite; Harhas.
from {{h2787}}; fever (as hot); extreme burning.
from a primitive root meaning to engrave; a chisel or graver; also a style for writing; graving tool, pen.
from passive participle of {{h2763}} and {{h639}}; snub-nosed; Charumaph, an Israelite; Harumaph.
or (shortened) חָרֻל; apparently, a passive participle of an unused root probably meaning to be prickly; properly, pointed, i.e. a bramble or other thorny weed; nettle.
from {{h2356}} and a collateral (masculine) form of {{h1412}}, with the article interposed; hole of the cleft; Chor-hag-Gidgad, a place in the Desert; Hor-hagidgad.

a primitive root (compare {{h2787}}); to glow or grow warm; figuratively (usually) to blaze up, of anger, zeal, jealousy; be angry, burn, be displeased, × earnestly, fret self, grieve, be (wax) hot, be incensed, kindle, × very, be wroth. See {{h8474}}.
from an unused root meaning to perforate; properly, pierced, i.e. a bead of pearl, gems or jewels (as strung); chain.
; from {{h2734}} and {{h3050}}; fearing Jah; Charhajah, an Israelite; Harhaiah.
feminine of {{h2730}}; fear, anxiety; care, × exceedingly, fear, quaking, trembling.
from {{h2729}}; fearful; also reverential; afraid, trembling.
patrial from a derivative of {{h2729}} (compare {{h5878}}); a Charodite, or inhabitant of Charod; Harodite.
the same as {{h2731}}; Charadah, a place in the Desert; Haradah.
from {{h2727}}; the leaping insect, i.e. a locust; beetle.
a primitive root; to shudder with terror; hence, to fear; also to hasten (with anxiety); be (make) afraid, be careful, discomfit, fray (away), quake, tremble.
or חַרְבוֹנָה; of Persian origin; Charbona or Charbonah, a eunuch of Xerxes; Harbona, Harbonah.
a primitive root; properly, to leap suddenly, i.e. (by implication) to be dismayed; be afraid.
feminine of {{h2720}}; a desert; dry (ground, land).
from {{h2717}}; parching heat; drought.
from {{h2717}}; desolate; Choreb, a (generic) name for the Sinaitic mountains; Horeb.
feminine of {{h2721}}; properly, drought, i.e. (by implication) a desolation; decayed place, desolate (place, -tion), destruction, (laid) waste (place).
from {{h2717}}; parched or ruined; desolate, dry, waste.
a collaterally form of {{h2719}}; drought or desolation; desolation, drought, dry, heat, × utterly, waste.
the same as {{h2799}}; Charosheth, a place in Palestine; Harosheth.
from {{h2717}}; drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement; axe, dagger, knife, mattock, sword, tool.
(Aramaic) a root corresponding to {{h2717}}; to demolish; destroy.
a primitive root; properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately; find out, (make) search (out), seek (out), sound, try.
or (fully) חוּקֹק; from {{h2710}}; appointed; Chukkok or Chukok, a place in Palestine; Hukkok, Hukok.
from {{h2710}}; an enactment, a resolution; decree, thought.

a primitive root; properly, to hack, i.e. engrave (Judges 5:14, to be a scribe simply); by implication, to enact (laws being cut in stone or metal tablets in primitive times) or (gen.) prescribe; appoint, decree, governor, grave, lawgiver, note, pourtray, print, set.
or חֲרֵב; a primitive root; to parch (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to desolate, destroy, kill; decay, (be) desolate, destroy(-er), (be) dry (up), slay, × surely, (lay, lie, make) waste.
from an unused (and vulgar) root probably meaning to evacuate the bowels; excrement; dung. Also חֲרִי.
or (fully) חוֹר; from {{h2787}}; (compare {{h2751}}); properly, white or pure (from the cleansing or shining power of fire); hence (figuratively) noble (in rank); noble.
from {{h2713}}; examination, enumeration, deliberation; finding out, number, (un-) search(-able, -ed, out, -ing).
from {{h2790}}; a forest (perhaps as furnishing the material for fabric); bough, forest, shroud, wood.
the same as {{h2791}}; Cheresh, a Levite; Heresh.
from {{h2790}}; magical craft; also silence; cunning, secretly.

a primitive root; to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness); × altogether, cease, conceal, be deaf, devise, ear, graven, imagine, leave off speaking, hold peace, plow(-er, man), be quiet, rest, practise secretly, keep silence, be silent, speak not a word, be still, hold tongue, worker.
from {{h2792}}; magician; Charsha, one of the Nethinim; Harsha.
from {{h2790}}; a fabricator or any material; artificer, ( ) carpenter, craftsman, engraver, maker,   mason, skilful, ( ) smith, worker, workman, such as wrought.
from {{h2790}}; deaf (whether literally or spiritual); deaf.
active participle of {{h2790}}; a fabricator or mechanic; artificer.
from {{h2790}}; mechanical work; carving, cutting.
plural of {{h2796}}; mechanics, the name of a valley in Jerusalem; Charashim, craftsmen.
from {{h2691}} and the same as {{h5881}}; village of springs; Chatsar-Enan, a place in Palestine; Hazar-enan.
from {{h2691}} and {{h7776}}; village of (the) fox; Chatsar-Shual, a place in Palestine; Hazar-shual.

from {{h2710}}; an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage); appointed, bound, commandment, convenient, custom, decree(-d), due, law, measure, × necessary, ordinance(-nary), portion, set time, statute, task.
a primitive root; to carve; by implication, to delineate; also to entrench; carved work, portrayed, set a print.
from {{h2691}} and {{h5484}}; village of cavalry; Chatsar-Susah, a place in Palestine; Hazar-susah.
from {{h2691}} and the plural of {{h5483}}; village of horses; Chatsar-Susim, a place in Palestine; Hazar-susim.
from {{h2691}} and a derivative of {{h5869}}; village of springs; Chatsar-Enon, a place in Palestine; Hazar-enon.
feminine of {{h2706}}, and meaning substantially the same; appointed, custom, manner, ordinance, site, statute.
from an unused root probably meaning to bend; crooked; Chakupha, one of the Nethinim; Hakupha.
from {{h2787}}; arid; parched place.
a collateral form mediating between {{h2775}} and {{h2791}}; a piece of pottery; earth(-en), (pot-) sherd,   stone.
of uncertain derivation; a fetter; figuratively, a pain; band.
from {{h2782}}; a sour grape (as sharp in taste); kernel.
a primitive root; to grate the teeth; gnash.
a primitive root; to glow, i.e. literally (to melt, burn, dry up) or figuratively (to show or incite passion); be angry, burn, dry, kindle.
from {{h2778}}; reproachful; Chareph, an Israelite; Hareph.
from {{h2778}}; contumely, disgrace, the pudenda; rebuke, reproach(-fully), shame.
a primitive root; properly, to point sharply, i.e. (literally) to wound; figuratively, to be alert, to decide; bestir self, decide, decree, determine, maim, move.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h2782}} in the sense of vigor; the loin (as the seat of strength); loin.
